intro: Pedicularis stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
